dialogue.text: I tap on Haruka’s name in my phone and wait for her to answer.
Ami isn’t going to be around today, but I feel like there’s a good chance Haruka will still refuse to come over on the off chance that that changes- and understandably so.
The two of them meshed together just about as well as peanut butter and arsenic, so a refusal may very well be in the cards.
She’ll likely invite me to her house instead...but if the two of us are ever going to get anywhere, serious or not serious, some bridges need to be burned.
And yes, the bridge in this case has only existed for a combined total of three hours if you count all of the time she’s spent in my home.
But I want that number to grow.
And I’m also tired of riding the bus.
It smells bad and the seats are uncomfortable.
Hey, [harukamaster]. What’s up?
You busy tonight?
I am not. That’s actually why I’m calling.
Cool beans. Can I come hang out at your place?
Wait, really? Even after how things went with Ami last time?
Oh, I’m not worried about her today.
Why not?
Because she’s with Rin, Molly, and a few other girls I don’t know the names of right now.
They were all hanging out at one of the tables in the back of the cafe when I left.
I’m actually still in the car now, so I can start heading over if that's okay with you.
Yeah, that’s fine. I should be home soon anyway.
Sweet! Gonna hang up now since talking on the phone and driving is illegal. Byeeee!
Haruka hangs up and I quicken my pace so I can make it home before she gets there.
I’d feel a little bad having her stuck in her car while I’m still walking and-
Wait.
I could have asked her to pick me up...
Hey! Thanks for having me over again.
And thanks for not immediately bringing up my chest the second I walked through the door.
I learned my lesson last time.
You should teach Molly. She still does it at least five times every day.
That’s it? I figured it would be more.
Yeah, it’s actually a surprisingly low amount when you consider the type of person she is.
But I was more or less the same when I was her age, so I get it.
I can not imagine you being anything like that girl.
I definitely wasn’t as...outgoing as her.
But I was definitely on the geekier side and spent pretty much all of [high_school] being jealous of other, prettier girls.
Also, my “assets” didn’t really grow in until later, so I didn’t have any of that same envy I  get from my employees and...apparently now your [niece].
Well, I’m glad you turned out the way you did.
I’m probably biased since I see you pretty often, but I think you’re alright.
Hey, cool. I think you’re alright too. What are the chances of that?
We have so much in common.
We’re both adults.
We both look after [teenage]girls for at least six hours every day.
We both drink black coffee and wear...black shirts in the winter.
We’re both moderately attractive.
And great kissers.
I mean, I agree...But it's kind of weird for you to randomly bring that up again.
Oh my god! I really didn’t mean to say that out loud...
Freaking out will just make it more awkward. It’s not really a big deal.
Right. Because, when you’re married, it’s totally fine to just get drunk and make out with guys you barely even know.
And, of course, now it's awkward.
I wouldn’t say you barely know me. You-
I don’t even know your first name.
And the only reason I know your surname is because one of my employees told me.
So don’t act like that was just some little thing. It was so much bigger than that.
You were drunk. It happens.
I fucking know that! But it shouldn’t!
I’m so fucking...{i}alone{/i} every day that I couldn’t help but jump on the first guy who showed me some sort of affection!
Why is this happening?
Do you think I {i}want{/i} to feel this way about you?! Of course not!
But even now, I’m saying things that any sane, married woman would never say because I’m scared of what will happen if the guy I married never comes back!
And now, instead of thinking of my {i}husband{/i} fucking me any time I lay in bed and give into how pathetic I am, I’m thinking of you!
I’m sorry...that was totally random and uncalled for.
I’m just...really...I don’t know...
I keep trying to bottle up what happened back then and...how you were nice enough to not take advantage of me...
But there’s an ugly part of me that...
May have wished you did...
Why?...
Why’d he have to leave, [harukamaster]?
I miss him so much...
I miss not feeling like I’m the worst person in the world...
Being able to fall asleep at night...
And then waking up next to someone special to me...
I just want everything to go back to normal.
What exactly do you want me to say to that?
Who knows?
I’m clearly an indecisive {i}bitch{/i} who can’t even sort her own feelings out.
You really expect me to know what I want to hear from you?
I don’t know. Maybe I just needed to vent or something.
Is venting enough?
Probably not. But what else am I supposed to do? {i}Hug{/i} you and just commit to being a horrible person?
Give up hope altogether and choose a physical connection over an emotional one I’ve had for years?
If that’s what makes you happy.
What will make me happy is my husband coming back.
You know I can’t do anything about that.
Obviously.
There’s nothing you can do that will fix everything and there’s nothing I can do to successfully cope.
So what’s even the point? I lose no matter what.
I just want to go home and sleep now that I’ve ruined any chance of you ever inviting me over again.
Stupid Haruka. Stupid random emotional breakdowns.
Everything is stupid.
There are two options I have here.
And they’re ones that I’m familiar with since I’ve made this same choice in the past.
But now, it falls on me to decide things once and for all.
If I decide right now to leave Haruka and her marriage alone, I’ll be leaving things that way for good.
But...
If I’m okay with destroying everything she’s built over the years for an opportunity to hug her-
I can tap into her vulnerability right now-
And do the hug thing.
I can’t do it.
Not when she’s still this torn.
If I’m going to be a homewrecker, I at least need the woman to be fully on board.
I honestly couldn’t care less about Haruka’s husband.
But, to some extent, I care about Haruka.
And I am too kind to hug another man's wife.
Maybe we shouldn’t hang out today after all.
Hahaha...Yeah, I kind of deserve to be kicked out after that meltdown.
I’m sorry. I’m clearly not in the right state of mind today.
You’re a really good friend, Sensei.
I really get why Rin likes you so much.
You can be a great guy when you want to.
The catch is that I don’t normally want to, so consider yourself lucky.
I do. Really.
And if there’s ever anything I can do for you that isn’t...you know...
Unfaithful and horrible?
Yeah. If there’s anything like that, just let me know.
But, for now...I’m gonna head home.
It obviously doesn’t have to be right away, but...I {i}do{/i} hope you’ll invite me back sometime.
As friends...
{i}Interesting!{/i}
{i}It seems that you’ve chosen a path that doesn’t make you feel bad about yourself.{/i}
{i}Why?{/i}
{i}You know that nothing is real, don’t you?{/i}
{i}Now, you’re locked out of Haruka’s romance route.{/i}
{i}What if her husband IS dead, huh? Then what?{/i}
{i}You’re strange.{/i}
{i}You make strange choices.{/i}
{i}I don’t like you very much.{/i}
{i}Haruka’s lust stays exactly the same because you have morals!{/i}
